concept_data.title: statute for senators
concept_data.preferred_term: Statute for Members of the Parliament

summary: The "statute for senators" is a redirect to the "Statute for Members of the Parliament," which outlines the legal framework governing the roles, responsibilities, and privileges of Members of the European Parliament (MEPs). This statute is pivotal in ensuring the integrity and functionality of the parliamentary institution within the EU's legislative process. It delineates the rights and obligations of MEPs, thereby fostering accountability and transparency in their actions. By establishing clear regulatory guidelines, the statute enhances the democratic principles underpinning the EU, ensuring that parliamentary members operate within a structured legal context that supports effective governance and representation.
